Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • Graph
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Graph1, Graph2, Graph3, Graph4, Graph5

    public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a simple foundation for building undirected and directed graphs when the numbers of vertices and edges are known as well as the general outline of the graph. Not suited for building graphs dynamically (yet:) . Instances of the Node class are used here to form the graph. Instances of a ball class act as a visual representation of a Node. This class also makes a use of a GameArena class in which the graph is to be drawn.
    See Also:
    Node, GameArena, Ball

      • initNodes

        public java.util.List<Node> initNodes(Node source)

        Parameters:
        source - Node to mapped to the adjacency list
        Returns:
        a list in which adjacent nodes will be stored

      • addEdges

        public void addEdges(Node source,
                     Node mapped,
                     GameArena arena,
                     boolean directed,
                     java.lang.String side,
                     double pos)
        Adds an edge between two Nodes using either an arrow or a simple line depending whether the connection is directed or not. Makes a use of a Line class for an undirected connection and of an Arrow class for a directed one.
        Parameters:
        source - Node from which the connection is coming out
        mapped - Node to be mapped to that initiating the connection
        arena - Arena that the Lines/Arrows/Balls (Nodes) are to be added to
        directed - Stating whether the connection should be directed or undirected
        side - If the connection is directed and a self-arc is to be drawn, this parameter indicates on which side that arc should be
        pos - Position of the arrow along the line if the connection is directed (can hold a random value if undirected)
        See Also:
        Arrow, Note: If the connection is to be directed and a self-arc drawn, uses 2 Balls to represent that arc (one inside another).

      • addNodes

        public void addNodes(GameArena arena)
        Adding nodes visually on a GameArena object
        Parameters:
        arena - Arena on which the Nodes will be displayed

      • getConnections

        public java.lang.String getConnections(Node n)
        Method that obtains all the adjacent Nodes to the one provided as a parameter and displays them in the form of a String
        Parameters:
        n - Node which adjacency list is to be displayed
        Returns:
        String containing adjacent Nodes

      • addOptions

        public void addOptions(GameArena arena,
                       Rectangle exit,
                       Text exit_text,
                       Rectangle graph_info,
                       Text info_text)
        Adds Rectangles which act as buttons as well as a Text on them indicating an action after a "button" is pressed.
        Parameters:
        arena - Arena on which the Rectangles and Texts are to be displayed
        exit - A Rectangle indicating a "back" button
        exit_text - A Text indicating an action
        graph_info - A Rectangle that when pressed will show general info about a graph
        info_text - A text holding the general info about a graph

      • removeItems134

        public void removeItems134(GameArena arena,
                           Text n1_edges,
                           Text n2_edges,
                           Text n3_edges,
                           Text n4_edges,
                           Text general_info)
        A method which removes all Text representations of the Nodes' edges as well as the general info about a graph. Note: Exclusive only to Graph1, Graph3 and Graph4 classes as they hold the same number of Nodes.
        Parameters:
        arena - Arena from which the elements are to be removed
        n1_edges - Text representation of the edges of the Node1
        n2_edges - Text representation of the edges of the Node2
        n3_edges - Text representation of the edges of the Node3
        n4_edges - Text representation of the edges of the Node4
        general_info - Text holding a general graph description
        See Also:
        Graph1, Graph3, Graph4

      • printGraph

        public void printGraph()
        Prints the Graph in the command line as adjacency lists of the Nodes

      • closeGraph

        public void closeGraph()
        Allows to return to the selection screen after a particular Graph screen has been closed.

      • depthTraversal

        public void depthTraversal(Node n,
                           java.util.LinkedList<Node> list)
        Allows to perform a depth-first traversal on a Graph based on the Node that we start from.
        Parameters:
        n - Node as a starting point
        list - List to hold the result of the traversal (Nodes in a proper order)

      • printDepth

        public void printDepth(java.util.LinkedList<Node> list,
                       GameArena arena,
                       java.lang.String traversal_colour)
        Method that highlights visited Nodes in a consecutive manner allowing to visualise the depth-first traversal, also prints the order to the command line.
        Parameters:
        list - List holding the order of visited nodes after the invokation of a depthTraversal() method
        arena - Arena on which the highlighting is to be performed
        traversal_colour - The colour in which consecutive Nodes will be highlighted

      • breadthTraversal

        public void breadthTraversal(Node n,
                             java.util.LinkedList<Node> list)
        A method that performs a breadth-first traversal on a graph depending on the Node that we start from.
        Parameters:
        n - Node acting as a starting point
        list - List that the order of visited Nodes is stored in

      • printBreadth

        public void printBreadth(java.util.LinkedList<Node> list,
                         GameArena arena,
                         java.lang.String traversal_colour)
        Same as printDepth() but used to print and highlight a breadth-first traversal.
        Parameters:
        list - List holding the order of visited nodes after the invokation of a breadthTraversal() method
        arena - Arena on which the highlighting is to be performed
        traversal_colour - The colour in which consecutive Nodes will be highlighted

      • resetColour

        public void resetColour(java.util.LinkedList<Node> list,
                        GameArena arena,
                        java.lang.String colour)
        A method that resets the colour of the Nodes to what it was before an invokation of the depthTraversal() / breadthTraversal() methods.
        Parameters:
        list - Nodes which colours were changed
        arena - Arena that the Nodes are displayed on
        colour - String storing a colour in which the Nodes are to be displayed
